course.subject: OCES
course.name: Environmental Impact and Risk Assessment
course.description: This course gives an overview on the relationships between human health, environment, and sustainable development. Topics include the development and objectives of environmental impact and risk assessment; impacts of environmental quality (including air, water, wastes, ecology) and health risks; assessment and mitigation, public participation; sustainable development. Case studies and guest lectures will be included. For ENVS, LIFS and CHEM students in their third and fourth year of study only.
course.prerequisites: CHEM 1030 OR LIFS 1030 (prior to 2021-22)
